channel.title: Blogs on Portfolio Website for Nauman
channel.description: Recent content in Blogs on Portfolio Website for Nauman

item.title: CDC COVID-19 Public Use Data
item.description: Let us revisit the CDC Covid-19 Case Surveillance Data. There are well over 3 million entries of individual, de-identified patient data. Since this is a large file, I suggest you use vroom to load it and you keep cache=TRUE in the chunk options. Given the data we have, I would like you to produce two graphs that show death % rate: by age group, sex, and whether the patient had co-morbidities or not # Clean Covid data cleaned_covid_data <- covid_data %>% filter(age_group !

item.title: Climate Change
item.description: Climate change and temperature anomalies If we wanted to study climate change, we can find data on the Combined Land-Surface Air and Sea-Surface Water Temperature Anomalies in the Northern Hemisphere at NASA’s Goddard Institute for Space Studies. The tabular data of temperature anomalies can be found here To define temperature anomalies you need to have a reference, or base, period which NASA clearly states that it is the period between 1951-1980.

item.title: GDP Components Over Time and Among Countries
item.description: At the risk of oversimplifying things, the main components of gross domestic product, GDP are personal consumption (C), business investment (I), government spending (G) and net exports (exports - imports). You can read more about GDP and the different approaches in calculating at the Wikipedia GDP page. The GDP data we will look at is from the United Nations’ National Accounts Main Aggregates Database, which contains estimates of total GDP and its components for all countries from 1970 to today.

item.title: IMDB
item.description: Analysis of movies- IMDB dataset We will look at a subset sample of movies, taken from the Kaggle IMDB 5000 movie dataset # import data movies <- read_csv(file = "data/movies.csv") Besides the obvious variables of title, genre, director, year, and duration, the rest of the variables are as follows: gross : The gross earnings in the US box office, not adjusted for inflation budget: The movie’s budget cast_facebook_likes: the number of facebook likes cast members received votes: the number of people who voted for (or rated) the movie in IMDB reviews: the number of reviews for that movie rating: IMDB average rating Data Description - Are there any missing values (NAs)?

item.title: Nauman Khan Biography
item.description: Introduction My name is Muhammad Nauman Alam Khan and I was born and brought up in Paksitan, where I spent the first 16 years of my life. It was during my formative years that I was initially introduced to field hockey, a sport that I would go on to dedicate most of the next decade of my life to. Hockey I first played the sport casually at school before trying out for the school team, of which I became the captain of in my second year on the team.

item.title: Trump's Approval Margins
item.description: As we saw in class, fivethirtyeight.com has detailed data on all polls that track the president’s approval # Import approval polls data approval_polllist <- read_csv(file ="data/approval_polllist.csv") # or directly off fivethirtyeight website # approval_polllist <- read_csv('https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/trump-approval-data/approval_polllist.csv') glimpse(approval_polllist) ## Rows: 15,619 ## Columns: 22 ## $ president <chr> "Donald Trump", "Donald Trump", "Donald Trump",... ## $ subgroup <chr> "All polls", "All polls", "All polls", "All pol... ## $ modeldate <chr> "9/27/2020", "9/27/2020", "9/27/2020", "9/27/20.
